> [{quoted}](name=Fasmodey,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=uNNF9HsP,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-07-10T19:03:13.504+0000)
>
> We actually know a lot. More than most of characters.

Do we ¿

Yes.

Nasus can:

* shoot energy bolts

* summon "hellfires" from under his foes

* become bigger and stronger at will

* strike physically, powerful enough bisect 3 barbarians at once

* use sand to a point harsh and brutal enough to leave nothing behind except skeletons of a camel like animal in minutes.

* regenerate unbelivably, possibly even better than Wolverine

* sense powerful beings, and possibly read minds of mortal as it was described as the Ascended can see the spark of betrayal beyond flesh and punish people responsible of it by death.

Though it is not seen in lore, in his gameplay, it is said he can wither his foes and age them to death.

Xerath can:

* shoot arcane energy in many ways, of course

* control elements

* use telekinesis

* summon sandstorms and lightning bolts

* mind control

* create chains of arcane energy to imprison someone

* like Nasus, can sense powerful beings, but it is even better. It is actually magical vision at this point, since he could sense and see Sivir from miles away, and he says to Nasus "last of Azir's bloodline cannot hide me forever" after Nasus reveals him she is over his sight.

* protect his mind and thoughts from other Ascended, even as human. 

Azir can:

* shoot energy bolts

* control the sand, of course, and he is far better at this than Nasus can ever be.

* possibly use telekinesis, if not, it is sure he can lift structures of Shurima.

*  see the past through sand.

* same as Nasus and Xerath, can sense powerful beings. At this point I would say it is a generic power of the Ascended.

Renekton can:

* use his strength significantly better than Nasus, he is better at hand to hand combat. Reminding you Nasus is already impressive in physical strength.

* like Nasus, can become bigger and stronger at will

* regenerate better than Nasus

Super likely, there are things I forgot to list.

We don't know much about Azir and Renekton as they are not described in combat as Nasus and Xerath are but we know generic powers of the Ascended like regenerating, reading minds, resistance to heat etc. There are many, and it is just annoying that there will be always something I will forget, but I can promise you we know the Ascended better than most of characters.

Another thing to note that is unlike the other Ascended, Azir can apparently draw power directly from the Sun Disc to strengthen himself. It was stated by Rioter in a previous quote that if he and Xerath fought in the open desert, Xerath would almost certainly win. If they fought in/near the capital, however, Azir could muster enough strength to beat the Magus. This may be due to the fact that his Ascension was also unique, getting the power after saving Sivir's life as opposed to actually finishing the ritual with the sun priests.

Yeah.

Azir is possibly the most powerful Ascended in capital (for now), since he has everything he needs here. Sand, structures of Shurima, Sun Disc. He is in clear advantage here, but it is still not certain that he defeats Xerath even in capital, since he is the villain of story and villains are almost always more powerful than the hero.

I mean, if Xerath can't defeat Azir in capital, what is the point? What is the threat? That just means Azir is always safe, and Xerath is not a threat.

I think it always depends on the story when it comes to power level. Rioter opinions are opinions, they are their personal thoughts. 

What I am sure is, when Azir and Xerath meet, it will be epic. They are 2 Ascended that can destroy the capital   unitentionally. 

It would be even more epic if Renekton turns side and fight against Xerath for 3v1. I really want to see what Xerath is capable of when he gets serious. He couldn't get defeated at his weakest against the 2 high tier Ascended at their prime. Now he got control and state of mind,  sarcophagus is getting weaker, Nasus is a shadow of previous himself.

We did!

"He was a slender, studious boy who spent more time perusing the texts collected in the Great Library of Nasus than training to fight under the stern tutelage of the Ascended hero, Renekton."

Before he met Xerath he trained under Renekton because it was his obligation

After the attempt on his life that killed all of his older siblings in line for the throne

"Azir trained in combat, for the attack at the oasis had revealed how little he knew of the deadly arts. Renekton took up the task of teaching the growing prince, and under his aegis, Azir learned to wield sword and spear, to command warriors, and to read the ebb and flow of battle. The young heir elevated Xerath, his only trusted confidant, and made him his right hand man. To better counsel him, Azir tasked Xerath with seeking out knowledge wherever he could find it."

He wasn't the greatest warrior per say but he had a knack for reading the flow of battle and giving commands on the field. That's why instead of using his sand powers to attack directly he shapes them as soldiers and orders them around.

* Practically immortal.

* Can shoot lightning.

* Can fully bend sand completely to his will.

* Instantly strikes fear into every mortal on the planet whenever he yells "SHURIMA".

* Can make actually funny bird puns.

That's pretty much all of his powers.
Very powerfull sand bender,  can also create some energy blasts from his staff I think  (His autos )

he has the power to suck in any ELO below platinum

actually he just sucks in general right now so... I'd call him descended.
